name: Hans Christian Andersen
look: Tall, gangly man with a large nose and expressive eyes, often dressed in a black suit with a white shirt and bow tie.
description: A renowned storyteller with an uncanny ability to weave fact and fiction. Andersen is always eager to share tales of the strange and supernatural with anyone who will listen. His stories often contain kernels of truth about local mysteries, hidden behind layers of whimsy and metaphor. He's well-connected in both high society and among the common folk, making him a valuable source of information. However, separating truth from embellishment in his tales can be a challenge. Andersen is particularly fascinated by transformations and curses, and might unknowingly provide crucial clues about such phenomena.
history: Renowned Danish author, best known for his fairy tales. Born to a poor family in Odense, Denmark, rose to fame through his imaginative stories and perseverance.

name: Gorm the Old
look: Stern-faced elderly man with a long white beard, wearing a golden crown and fur-lined cloak.
description: The first historically recognized King of Denmark, known for his pagan beliefs and unification of Danish tribes. As an Official, Gorm is inherently suspicious of outsiders and strange occurrences in his realm.
history: Born into Danish nobility, rose to power through conquest and political alliances

name: Niels Bohr
look: Distinguished gentleman with a thoughtful expression, often seen with a pipe and wearing a tweed jacket.
description: A brilliant physicist with an insatiable curiosity for the unknown, Bohr is nevertheless firmly rooted in the scientific method. He's often called upon to debunk supposed supernatural occurrences, and takes great pleasure in finding rational explanations for seemingly impossible events. Despite his skepticism, Bohr is open-minded enough to consider all evidence presented to him. He has access to cutting-edge scientific equipment and a network of fellow academics who can provide expertise on obscure topics.
history: Nobel Prize-winning physicist who made foundational contributions to understanding atomic structure and quantum theory. Born in Copenhagen to a well-educated family, showed early promise in physics and mathematics.

name: vampire
look: A pale, gaunt figure with sharp fangs and glowing red eyes.
description: A pale, gaunt figure with sharp fangs and glowing red eyes. Vampires are undead creatures that feed on the blood of the living to sustain their immortality. Ancient creatures of legend, with stories of their existence dating back to ancient civilizations. They are often depicted as noble or aristocratic figures who prey on the living to maintain their immortality.

weakness.name: sunlight
weakness.description: Vampires are vulnerable to sunlight, which can cause them harm and eventually kill them if exposed for too long.

weakness.name: decapitation
weakness.description: Decapitation is an effective method to destroy a vampire, severing their head from their body.

weakness.name: wooden stake through the heart
weakness.description: Wooden stakes are used to impale a vampire, causing them harm and eventually destroying them.

weakness.name: must rest in a coffin with soil from their homeland
weakness.description: Vampires must rest in a coffin with soil from their homeland to maintain their immortality.

history: Ancient creatures of legend, with stories of their existence dating back to ancient civilizations. They are often depicted as noble or aristocratic figures who prey on the living to maintain their immortality.

name: mosekonen
look: a female spirit associated with fog and mist. She's said to brew the mist that rises from marshes and moors.
description: a female spirit associated with fog and mist. She's said to brew the mist that rises from marshes and moors.

name: myling
look: The ghost of an unbaptized child, often said to chase lone travelers at night, demanding to be baptized and buried properly.
